creator: johnhart@au1.ibm.com
text:
Install build failure:
... Failed Building Ant Distribution !
Bootstrap FAILED

OS:
IRIX 6.5.19
Java SDK:
Java 2 v1.4.1 APIs for SGI IRIX - MR Release

Build fails due to Java compile errors:
<path...>/depend/ClassFile.java:61: package
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.depend.constantpool does not exist
import org.apache.tools.ant.tasksdefs.optional.depend.constantpool.ClassCPInfo;

I checked directories, package exists, in directory required.
I tryed to compile ClassFile.java buy itself from the command like and it came
up with the same error.
Could this be a problem with the Java compiler on this platform?

Ant builds are working on a variety of platforms, so it sounds like an IRIX 
specific problem.
You might want to try to compile this class :
org.apache.tools.ant.tasksdefs.optional.depend.constantpool.ClassCPInfo
then try again to compile
org.apache.tools.ant.tasksdefs.optional.depend.ClassFile
and see whether the problem persists.
You can also try to change your copy of ant's build.xml file and do
<javac verbose="true" ... so that you get more error output.
Antoine
creator: antoine@apache.org
johnhart@au1.ibm.com
text:
Antoine,
Went to compile:
org.apache.tools.ant.tasksdefs.optional.depend.constantpool.ClassCPInfo
and noticed that file names had been truncated.
This was due to use of SGI tar (enforces namelength limits)
I installed gnu tar and now files have been extracted and so build works.
Thanks.
John.
